answerText: Mrs. Malaprop[10] Mrs. Malaprop appears in The Rivals by this Anglo-Irish playwright of A Trip to Scarborough.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Yale A + Minnesota A | 11 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This character declares: "Sure, if I reprehend any thing in this world it is the use of my oracular tongue, and a nice derangement of epitaphs". For 10 points each:  [10] Name this character, the guardian of Lydia Languish, who in one scene declares Jack Absolute to be "the very pine-apple of politeness!".
